public class PizzaItem
extends CookedItem

Author: Grant Kurtz, Jason Greaves Stores all information necessary to represent a pizza.

Constructor Detail

PizzaItem

public PizzaItem(java.lang.String pizza_size,
                 double topping_amount,
                 TimeReader time,
                 CookedItem item)
Creates the topping to go on the pizza. Pepperoni is an automatic topping and is free.

Parameters:
pizza_size - Size of the pizza
topping_amount - Amount of toppings to put on the pizza
time - The time class that will accurately report the current simulation time.
item - the CookedItem instance to get information from.

The size of the pizza

setSize

public void setSize(PizzaItem.Size size)
Parameters:
size - The size of the pizza

setToppingAmount

public void setToppingAmount(double topping_amount)
Parameters:
topping_amount - amount of toppings on the pizza. Can only be .5 or 1.0. If anything else given, tells the user and auto sets the topping amount to 1.0.

addTopping

public void addTopping(PizzaItem.Topping topping)
Parameters:
topping - The topping to go on the pizza

removeTopping

public void removeTopping(PizzaItem.Topping topping)
Parameters:
topping - The topping to be removed from pizza

getToppingCost

public double getToppingCost()
Calculates the cost of toppings for each size of pizza depending if there is more than one topping on the pizza or a pizza with a topping other than pepperoni is ordered.

Returns:
cost of the toppings on the pizza
